body.p: Oracc LAK is a fontification of A. Deimel, Liste der archaischen Keilschriftzeichen (WVDOG 40; Berlin 1922).

PNG files of individual LAK signs were excerpted from a scanned copy by Steve Tinney. They were turned into SVG files by Vijay Kethana and are available at https://github.com/vkethana/cuneiform_convert.

Steve Tinney aligned the SVG filenames with Unicode and created an initial TrueType font from the SVG files. This font is still under development: it has been roughly resized and recentered but requires further tuning.
Oracc LAK is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1.
All of the Oracc fonts are downloadable from the Oracc II GitHub repository.
In Oracc projects the font is selected with the CSS class ofs-olak.
